Nerangs.ab: pad niuuaēδaiiemi. bōy ō ī ātaxš dahišn xšnūman pad menišn frāz kunišn ud yazdān ō yazišn xwānišn niuuaēδaiiemi. haṇkāraiiemi. daϑušō. ahurahe. mazdā̊. ...
"At ńiuuaēδaiiemi he has to give bōy to the fire, recite the šnūman mentally and call the gods to the yazišn and continue with niuuaēδaiiemi haṇkāraiiemi daϑušō ahurahe mazdā̊. ..."

Quotations.ab: bōy ī ō puhl šawēd ēn niuuaēδaiiemi
"Following offerings of bōy go to the bridge: (the one) at niuuaēδaiiemi."
ŠnŠ9.11 Tavadia 1930: p. 120, cf. Shaked 2004, p. 340:
pad hamāg yazišn pad bun ī yazišn ud bun ī drōn yazdān ud ahlawān frawahr be ō yazišn niwēyēnišn
"In each ceremony (yazišn), at the beginning of the yazišn and at the beginning of the drōn, (the priest) has to invite to the ceremony the gods and the frawahr of the ahlaw."

ab.ab: "At the outset of the recitation of the first chapter of the Yasna, the zōt moistens the date palm cord, tied around the barsom, with water from the large basin. Each new chapter of the Yasna will be marked by this ritual act. Both priests recite sianzas (sts.) 1-3 and later 17-23 (Y.1.1-3, 17-23)."
